title: Nagpur Foodgrain Prices Open- October 07, 2019
text:
Nagpur Foodgrain Prices Open- October 07, 2019

Commodities 31 minutes ago (Oct 07, 2019 14:10)

Nagpur Foodgrain Prices Open- October 07, 2019 Nagpur Foodgrain Prices – APMC/Open Market-October 7, 2018 Nagpur, Oct 7 (Reuters) – Gram and tuar prices recovered strongly in Nagpur Agriculture Produce and Marketing Committee (APMC) here good festival season demand from local millers amid weak supply from producing belts. Notable rise on NCDEX in gram, good recovery in Madhya Pradesh gram prices and enquiries from South-based millers also jacked up prices. About 550 bags of gram and 50 bags of tuar reported for auction, according to sources. FOODGRAINS & PULSES * Gram Kabuli firmed up in open market here on good seasonal demand from local traders. * Tuar gavarani reported higher in open market here on renewed demand from local traders. * Moong Chamki firmed up in open market here on good festival season demand from local traders amid weak supply from producing regions. * In Akola, Tuar New – 5,500-5,700, Tuar dal (clean) – 8,100-8,200, Udid Mogar (clean) – 7,600-8,500, Moong Mogar (clean) 8,200-8,900, Gram – 4,300-4,400, Gram Super best – 5,600-6,000 * Wheat, rice and other foodgrain items moved in a narrow range in scattered deals and settled at last levels in thin trading activity. Note: n.a.--not available (For oils, transport costs are excluded from plant delivery prices, but included in market prices) ATTN : Soyabean mandi, wholesale foodgrain market of Nagpur APMC and oil market in Vidarbha will be closed tomorrow, Tuesday, on the occasion of Dusshera.
